result.execSummary:
The defendant Freddy Lee Lovett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

Provide a DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Pay the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Pay restitution in the amount of $1,000.00 payable to the victim, Rokenia C-S. -  to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
***10/3/2014  Court administrately orderd defendant to pay $3,200.41 payable to victim Margaret T. To be paid over  period of probation, ref. case 14CF1926.   Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
**Hearing 11/14/2014 for uncharged read in

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes: Straight time. STAYED. To be used at the probation department's discretion.

records.addlTxt: To br. 2

Defendant Freddy Lee Lovett in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Defendant Freddy Lee Lovett in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED):    Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statements made by victim, Margaret T.
Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS. 
Credit given for 143 days time served if revoked.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
.
COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 4 YEARS under the supervision of the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* Serve 1 YEAR "condition time" as straight time - STAYED.  To be used at the Probation Department's discretion.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $1,000.00 payable to the victim, Rokenia C-S. - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered the Dosage Probation Program.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Parties request to schedule a restitution hearing on the uncharged read-in.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 11-14-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for a Restitution Hearing on the uncharged read-in.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.

Defendant Freddy Lee Lovett in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Defendant Freddy Lee Lovett in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Jury Trial today, however, the parties have now reached an agreement.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court AMENDS Count #1  of the complaint to include the modifier "as a Party to a Crime", contrary to Wisc. Stats. 939.05.  
 NO AMENDED INFORMATION FILED.

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED):    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Quetionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.
with attached Restitution Worksheet filed by ADA Timothy Cotter on behalf of the State.

Attorney Richard J. Carpenter in court, defendant Freddy Lee Lovett not in court, in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties are unable to proceed with a Plea and Sentencing Hearing today.
Judge Donald is currently in trial on an unrelated matter.
Case adjourned to the already scheduled Jury Trial date on 09-29-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.
**Parties anticipate this case resolving on the next court date.

Attorney Richard J. Carpenter in court, defendant Freddy Lee Lovett not in court, in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Final Pretrial Conference today, however, the parties are close to reaching an agreement.
Parties request a Plea and Sentencing date for time to work out the details of the resolution.
Case adjourned to 09-24-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Attorney Richard J Carpenter in court, defendant Freddy Lee Lovett not in court, in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  **Speedy trial demand made today.
Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 08-19-2014 at 8:30 AM and for Jury Trial on 09-29-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

Attorney Richard J Carpenter in court, defendant Freddy Lee Lovett not in court, in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke for Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The assigned ADA is currently out on medical leave.
Parties request another scheduling conference date.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 06-27-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Scheduling Conference.
OF DISCHARGE from Justice Point Pretrial Services; filed.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.

Defendant Freddy Lee Lovett in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Tyrone St. Junior for Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
